page.title: 19THE HISTORY OF SPAXTON.
page.content: Mentionod in the Domesday survey of 1086 spracestone as haveing 30 Acres of meadows 129 Acres of wood with 24 cottages and servants. This could refer to the manor rather than the village The Manor of Tuxwell in 1593 was held by Robert Blake who later became Admiral Blake. The land of Spaxton belonged to the Malet family Enmore who were Lords of the Manor from 1100 _ 1681 The estata then passed to John per ceval Eail of Egmont who puiul Enmore caskle. The Eskahe was solded in 1803 to Henry Labouchere later Lord Taunton. He died 13th July 1869 leaving a daughter Mary Dorothy Ahanley. Spaxton remained in the Stanley faimly until 191
